Items below are Resource Types used by Virgo, the Library catalog. Click to read more about Collections at the UVA Library. 

Articles

A convenient aggregation of tens of millions of articles made available through Library subscriptions.

Books

Physical and electronic books from UVA’s collection.

Images

Imagery that the UVA Library has curated, collected, and described.

Journals

Journals, magazines, newspapers, and other periodicals. May be available in print, electronic access journals, bound volumes containing multiple issues, or online. NOTE: Display has not yet been optimized for these types of materials and much of the content isn't yet discoverable.

Manuscripts & Archival Material

Published and unpublished manuscripts, business records, maps, correspondence, and more. Items may be requested for access in the Clifton Waller Barrett Reading Room and cannot leave the premises.

Maps

Maps, atlases, and other cartographic materials.

Music Recordings

Music-based audio available for streaming, download, or in-person use.

Musical Scores

Sheet music and other musical notation.

Sound Recordings

Non-music audio available for streaming, download, or in-person use.

Theses

Theses and dissertations completed at the University of Virginia.

Video

Documentaries, films, television shows, and more; for check out or streaming access.

Visit Virgo now

Jefferson-Madison Regional Library (JMRL)

Materials from Charlottesville’s public library system, Jefferson-Madison Regional Library.

WorldCat

WorldCat is the world's most comprehensive database of information about library collections. WorldCat results in Virgo do not include items that are found elsewhere in UVA’s central collection. Learn more about WorldCat.
